page.title: 19Interview-Salts Avenue
page.content: A smart youngish woman of about 45 was walking up the road to get the dog she was looking after. She had a large house in Salts Avenue which is about 50 years old. The house was detached with a gret tiled roof. The house was built of brick with a large front garden, mainly lawn and rose beds. She had a son called Peter and had moved from East Farleigh so that her son could go to the grammar school that was nearby. She had an enormous garden at the back. Her husband worked at the East Malling Research Station. She went shopping once a week at a supermarket in Larkfield. She gave us a drink of orange squash!
